articles.title: American to Be Judged in DPRK
articles.content:
American to Be Judged in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The Supreme Court of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea decided to judge American Miller Matthew Todd now in custody on September 14, according to the indictment of a relevant institution.

articles.title: CPRK Demands Pullout of U.S. Forces in S. Korea
articles.content:
CPRK Demands Pullout of U.S. Forces in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) released a statement Sunday on the lapse of 69 years since the U.S. imperialists' illegal occupation of south Korea.
					 The U.S. occupied south Korea on September 8, 1945 under the pretext of "disarming the Imperial Japanese Army", the start of craftier and tyrannical colonial rule by the U.S. that replaced the Japanese imperialists, the statement said.
					
					 The U.S. occupation of south Korea forced the Korean nation to undergo unprecedented misfortune of division and the most devastating war at the hands of the U.S., the Korean nation being divided into the north and the south, it noted, and went on:
					
					 Under the U.S. domination and occupation, south Korea turned into a military base for invading the northern half of Korea and Asia and dominating the world and into an outpost for a nuclear war. This posed the constant danger of war to the Korean nation.
					
					 The U.S. does not want the Korean nation getting reconciled, achieving unity and advancing for reunification. So it instigates the puppet forces to escalate hostility with the north and fight against fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 It is not possible to improve the north-south relations nor is it possible to achieve peace, reunification and prosperity of the country and the nation as long as the U.S. military presence in south Korea is left intact.
					
					 It is imperative to end at an early date the U.S. imperialists' occupation of south Korea, the root cause of all misfortunes and sufferings of the Korean nation.
					
					 Gone are the days when the U.S. disguised itself as "protector" and "helper" of south Korea and no Korean wants the U.S. imperialist aggression forces to remain in south Korea.  
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its anachronistic policy of occupying south Korea and its hostile policy toward the DPRK and pull out of south Korea at once together with its aggression troops before meeting a final destruction in the face of the strong protest of the Koreans and the merciless retaliatory blows by the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop acting as henchmen of the U.S. and imploring for the U.S. imperialist aggression forces' permanent presence in south Korea.
					
					 If the present regime of south Korea has a true intent on improving the north-south relations, it should discard the pro-American policy, stop all DPRK-targeted war drills in league with the U.S. and make a bold decision of withdrawing the U.S. forces from south Korea.
					
					 Herein lies a key to achieving the peace and reunification of the Korean peninsula and improving the north-south relations.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Brazil
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Brazil
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Dilma Vana Rousseff, president of Brazil, on the occasion of the 192nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in conformity with the common interests and desire of the two peoples and sincerely wished the president and people of Brazil greater successes in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Brazilian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Brazilian FM
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Sunday sent a message of greeting to Luiz Alberto Figeiredo Machado, foreign minister of Brazil, on the occasion of the 192nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the cooperation between the foreign ministries for the development of friendly relations between the two countries would go on well and wished him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Congratulations to New Turkish PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to New Turkish PM
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Aumet Davutoglu upon his appointment as prime minister of Turkey on September 5.
					 The message wished the Turkish government success in its work for the development and prosperity of the country. 
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Mevlut Cavusoglu congratulating his appointment as foreign minister of Turkey on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 66th birthday of the DPRK Sunday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun. The group is led by Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan Ho Jong Man.
					 Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, accompanied the group.
					
					 The members of the group paid profound homage to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in deep reverence for them.
					
					 At halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, the visitors paid tribute to them.
					
					 The visitors looked round halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 Ho Jong Man made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. The group is headed by Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). 
					 It was accompanied by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK. 
					
					 Members of the group laid bouquets before the graves of the President's grandparents Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik and his parents Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok and paid silent tribute to them. 
					
					 They visited the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum which houses historic materials and relics showing the revolutionary activities of the President and his family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					 They looked round historic relics at the President's old home, being briefed on the immortal stories associated with it.
					
					 Ho Jong Man said:
					
					 Visiting Mangyongdae, I feel irresistible yearning for Generalissimo Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He brought the liberation of the country to the Koreans in Japan who had lived with the grief of statelessness, and put forward them as overseas citizens of the independent and sovereign state.
					
					 I can never forget the great loving care and benevolence shown by him for the Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan no matter how much water may flow under the bridge.
					
					 The feats he performed by forming Chongryon and developing it into a model organization of the movement of overseas compatriots will shine forever.
					
					 We will usher in a new heyday of Chongryon under the leadership of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, holding the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as the sun of Juche for all ages in high esteem.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Jong Il Sim, widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, Sunday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 She laid a floral basket before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 They were handed over to General of the Korean People's Army Hyon Yong Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, by Zhang Ping, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy who is doyen of the corps, on Sunday.

articles.title: Foreigners, Overseas Koreans Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners, Overseas Koreans Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Foreigners and overseas Koreans visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					 They included the Yamanashi Prefectural delegation for Japan-DPRK friendship led by Yasunobu Kanemaru, president of the Television Yamanashi Co., Ltd., the delegation of the EU-Asia Centre led by Director Fraser Cameron and the home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan led by Pak Hae Chol, vice department director of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
					
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Delegation of British Businessmen's Association Here
articles.content:
Delegation of British Businessmen's Association Here
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the British Businessmen's Association led by Evgeny Lebedev arrived here Sunday.

articles.title: Flower Show Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Flower Show Held in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A national flower show took place at the April 15 Children's Flower Garden here on September 4-7, with the 66th birthday of the DPRK as an occasion.
					 Taking part in the show were officials and cultivators in the fields of horticulture and urban management as well as floral fans from across the country.
					
					On display there were more than 20,000 potted flowers and flower shrubs of at least 1,400 species.
					
					 The April 15 Children's Flower Garden and the Central Botanical Garden presented Kimilsungia, Kimjongilia and other species of flowers and miniature flower gardens.
					
					 Flower experts and visitors to the show shared some experiences they got in flower cultivation.
					
					 During the show, works were conducted to disseminate the advanced flower cultivation methods through sci-tech presentation.

articles.title: National Educational Experimental Apparatus and Teaching Aids Exhibition, Educational Aid Exhibition Close
articles.content:
National Educational Experimental Apparatus and Teaching Aids Exhibition, Educational Aid Exhibition Close
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The national educational experimental apparatus and teaching aids exhibition and the education aid exhibition closed with due ceremonies at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Sunday. They opened with the approach of the 13th National Meeting of Educators.
					 Highly appreciated at the exhibitions were multimedia and simulation experimental program and ultramodern scientific and educational experimental apparatus which are conducive to raising practical ability of students and putting education on an IT and ultra-modern basis. They were manufactured and put to use by teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Phyongsong University of Education and other universities.
					
					 Evoking positive responses also were educational equipment and materials for management prepared by officials of the Ministry of Public Health, Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport, Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, the State Academy of Sciences, Ministry of Railways, Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications, Ministry of Commerce and other ministries and national institutions.
					
					 Present there were Han Kwang Bok, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of ministries and national institutions and officials, teachers and kindergarteners in the field of education.
					
					 The jury results were made public and citations were awarded to units and participants who proved successful at the exhibitions.
					
					 Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, made a closing address.

articles.title: Participants in Workers Art Festival Give Performance
articles.content:
Participants in Workers Art Festival Give Performance
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Participants in the 54th National Art Festival of Workers for celebrating the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK gave a performance "May Great Paektusan Nation Prosper Forever" at the Central Hall of Workers on Sunday. 
					 The performance was given by art circle members of the Kumhwa Mine, Service Management Station of the Myonggan Coal Mine, the Ongjin Mine and the Taean Friendship Glass Factory who were selected in the art festival. 
					
					 The performance began with narration and chorus "Ode to the Motherland" and "Joy of the People". Put on the stage were colorful numbers including poem and story-telling "Greatest Happiness", kayagum ensemble "Nilliri for Songun" and dance "Song of Big Fish Haul". 
					
					 The performers praised President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for glorifying the DPRK as an invincible socialist power dignified with independence, self-sustenance and self-defence. 
					
					 The performance showed noble sentiment of the Korean people with high artistic skill. It ended with poem and chorus "We Know Nobody but You". 
					
					 It was enjoyed by Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, officials and members of the federation and workers.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Lauds Immortal Feats of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Lauds Immortal Feats of Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- No matter how much water may flow under the bridge and no matter how frequently a generation is replaced by another, the Korean people will always remember the immortal feats President Kim Il Sung performed by exalting the dignity and honor of the popular masses, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Thanks to the President, a fundamental turn was brought about in the position and role of the popular masses who had been subject to suppression and maltreatment in the past and a modern history began.
					
					 Just a century ago, the Korean people had to accept flunkeyism and statelessness as their fate as they were not correctly guided and had no force to defend themselves even though they had a history spanning five thousand years and brilliant culture.
					
					 It was the President who dropped the curtain on the distress-torn history and put the dignity and honor of the Korean people on the highest stage for the first time in the nation's history.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of the President, the Korean people could regain the dignity and rights of independent human beings free from the yoke of colonial slavery and enjoy a genuine life and happiness. 
					
					 Thanks to the popular leadership of the President, the Korean revolution could make a new history of the Juche revolution without even a single mistake or failure in implementing its line and the Korean people emerged a dignified and proud people led by the outstanding leader, shedding its rays all over the world. 
					
					 The Korean people should translate his life-long desire into a reality as befitting his descendants, bearing in mind the immortal feats he performed on behalf of the era and the revolution, the country and its people.
					
					 All party members and other people will carry on the dynamic struggle in order to glorify his immortal feats and bring earlier the victory of his idea and cause.

articles.title: Prospect of Inter-Korean Relations Entirely Hinges on Attitude of S. Korean Authorities: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Prospect of Inter-Korean Relations Entirely Hinges on Attitude of S. Korean Authorities: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The prospect of the relations between the north and the south of Korea entirely depends on the stand and attitude of the south Korean authorities, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Those who pushed the inter-Korean relations to a catastrophe by staging military exercises are becoming talkative about "dialogue" in a bid to evade their responsibility, but this third-rate plot cannot go down with anyone.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are talking about dialogue while staging madcap war exercises against the north in collusion with the U.S. imperialists. This is no more than an unpardonable mockery of the other party and an intolerable hypocrisy towards the public opinion at home and abroad.
					
					 The puppet group can never evade the responsibility for having blocked the dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south and increased the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula to an extreme pitch.
					
					 The DPRK has made every sincere effort to improve the inter-Korean relations, prompted by its will to pave the way for peace and reunification even at a time when the south Korean authorities went to extremes in their confrontation with the DPRK and war moves.
					
					 Nevertheless, the puppet group reacted to the DPRK's goodwill with an extreme evil intention.
					
					 How can one trust those who pounce upon the other party with daggers hidden under their belts and how can one believe in their call for "dialogue".
					
					 The inter-Korean relations cannot become a scapegoat for the south Korean ruling forces' policy of confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should properly clarify whether they stand for dialogue or confrontation and for peace or war.
					
					 If they are sincerely concerned for the improved inter-Korean relations and dialogue, they should make a decision to definitely stop all joint military drills for aggression with the U.S.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Moves to Build "North's Human Rights Record Exhibition"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Moves to Build "North's Human Rights Record Exhibition"
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities are frantically staging the "human rights" campaign against the north when the inter-Korean relations have been extremely bedeviled. For example, they are now mulling building the "north's human rights record exhibition". 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said moves are a blatant politically motivated provocation intended to drive the north-south relations into an uncontrollable catastrophe.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' moves to build such exhibition can never be overlooked as they are a height of their anti-DPRK human rights campaign. 
					
					 The above-said desperate moves clearly prove that they do not wish improved inter-Korean relations at all but seek only confrontation between fellow countrymen and the unification of social systems against the will of the nation. 
					
					 The provocation made by the puppet forces against the north through an extreme anti-DPRK human rights campaign under the prevailing situation is as reckless an act as driving the north-south relations into an uncontrollable catastrophe. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities are now running the whole gamut of rhetoric about "dialogue" between the north and the south. 
					
					 However, the said provocative moves self-exposed that their much touted "dialogue" is nothing but a lie to deceive public opinion.
					
					 The DPRK has already advised and warned them more than once that the confrontation of the social systems is bound to lead to a final ruin. 
					
					 Time will prove the north's warning is not hot air. The group of traitors in south Korea is bound to face a stern punishment by history for its noisy anti-DPRK human rights campaign adding to their crimes against the nation.

articles.title: U.S. Forces in S. Korea Are Root Cause of Disturbing Peace in Korea: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Forces in S. Korea Are Root Cause of Disturbing Peace in Korea: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- 69 years have passed since the U.S. forces occupied south Korea, Minju Joson Sunday says in a commentary.
					 The U.S. forces in south Korea are the root cause of deteriorating the situation on the Korean peninsula and disturbing regional peace and they are a cancer-like entity, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 After the liberation of Korea there was a strong demand for the withdrawal of foreign forces from Korea. However, the U.S. forces stayed in south Korea, seeking their permanent presence there. They have committed ceaseless military hostile acts against the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. shifted the pivot of its strategy for world domination in the 21st century to the Asia-Pacific region, regarding the Korean peninsula as a theatre of stand-off of force. 
					
					 If a military conflict occurs on the peninsula, it will quickly spill over to its neighboring countries and the U.S. will not be safe either. 
					
					 The U.S. forces should be withdrawn from south Korea not only for the sake of peace on the peninsula and in the rest of the world but also for the lives of tens of thousands of American troops in south Korea. 
					
					 As a matter of fact, the U.S. troops in south Korea are little short of hostages held by the DPRK. If the DPRK opens fire, the miserable U.S. soldiers in south Korea will never escape an annihilation. 
					
					 Now is a good time for the U.S. troops to go back politely. 
					
					 If the U.S. persists in military confrontation with the DPRK despite its warnings, the U.S. will be wholly responsible for the ensuing catastrophic consequences.

articles.title: Moves to Shut down Newspaper Jaju Minbo Denounced
articles.content:
Moves to Shut down Newspaper Jaju Minbo Denounced
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy of south Korea held a meeting in Seoul on Sept. 4 in protest against the puppet authorities' moves to shut down the internet newspaper Jaju Minbo. 
					 Speakers at the meeting accused the court of making a decision at a trial to cancel registration in favor of the Seoul City authorities which filed a suit against Jaju Minbo. It is an undemocratic ruling against progressive media, they said, and went on:
					
					 Media which should be closed are conservative ones slandering the north often and begging the U.S. to stifle the fellow countrymen in the north. 
					
					 However, the authorities do not take issue with such media but try to shut down Jaju Minbo, which has called for achieving independent and peaceful reunification in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself. 
					
					 The speakers declared they would not tolerate the moves of the above-said forces to shut down Jaju Minbo.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korea Mull Forming Combined Division
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korea Mull Forming Combined Division
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and south Korean military warmongers are going to form a combined division by 2015, according to south Korean media. 
					 The commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the south Korean puppet army disclosed the plan on September 4. 
					
					 The division will stem from the Second Division of the U.S. forces in south Korea and include a brigade-level unit of the south Korean puppet army. A major general of the U.S. forces will be commander of the division and a brigadier general of the south Korean puppet army vice-commander of the division. 
					
					 Staff officers of the south Korean army will join the command of the Second Division of the U.S. forces. 
					
					 The operation plan of the combined division is being worked out in the direction of carrying out a civil operation and special operation in the DPRK. 
					
					 By forming the combined division the U.S. imperialists seek to put the south Korean army under tighter control and intensify the joint military drills in a bid to step up the preparations for a war against the DPRK. 
					
					 South Korean people from all walks of life are becoming increasingly vocal demanding the cancellation of the plan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un' Work Posted on Website of Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un' Work Posted on Website of Russia
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- A conclusion made by Marshal Kim Jong Un at the March 2013 plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea was posted on Khabinfo. Ru, the website of Khabarovsk Territory of Russia, on Sept. 2.
					His photo was also posted on the website.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Marked in Mexico
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Marked in Mexico
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Mexico to mark the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The Socialist Popular Party of Mexico held a meeting, the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism held a seminar on the theme of "DPRK guided by Juche idea" and the Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il gave a lecture on August 30 and September 1.
					
					 On display there were photos of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works and photos documenting the achievements made by the army and people of the DPRK in building a thriving nation.
					
					 Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, said the DPRK turned into a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, its Secretary General Arquimedez Perez Bello and other speakers said as the DPRK thoroughly embodied the Juche idea in all fabrics of social life, it could achieve big successes in the economic construction despite all sorts of sanctions and blockade of the imperialists.
					
					 Andres Gasca Sanchez, president of the Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, said Kim Il Sung was a peerless statesman who founded the DPRK and built it into a socialist fortress, praising him as a political elder who rendered distinguished services for the world socialist movement and the human cause of independence under the banner of independence against imperialism.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Dedicate Articles to Day of Songun in DPRK
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Dedicate Articles to Day of Songun in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers on Aug. 25 carried articles illustrated with portraits of smiling leader Kim Jong Il and his photos documenting his Songun leadership feats on the occasion of the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 The Russian paper Pri Armurskiye Wedomostsi in an article titled "By dint of Songun" cited facts that he displayed traits and qualifications as a peerless brilliant commander in the ceaseless confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 The Syrian paper Al Baath in an article titled "On occasion of 54th Day of Songun in DPRK" said that the feats he performed by providing an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country and nation with his outstanding and experienced leadership will always be remembered along with the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					
					 The Indian paper New Delhi Times devoted its two whole pages to articles titled "Will of Songun" and "Holding higher banner of Songun" under the headline "Songun Aug. 25".
					
					 The DR Congo paper L'Avenir in an article titled "Undying Songun feats" said that the Songun revolutionary leadership provided by him for decades ushered in a new era of the greatest prosperity in the history of the Korean nation, citing in detail the feats he performed by strengthening the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Film shows were held in Mongolia, Singapore and Nigeria from August 29 to September 2 on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Films shown included Korean film "Munsu Water Park".
					
					 Watching films were figures of various circles of relevant countries and other people.

articles.title: Miller Matthew Todd sera juzgado en RPDC
articles.content:
Miller Matthew Todd sera juzgado en RPDC
Pyongyang, 7 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Tribunal Supremo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea decidio juzgar el 14 de septiembre al estadounidense retenido Miller Matthew Todd segun la acusacion de un organo competente.
